label: 天下
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: A term from Chinese political theory meaning all under heaven" or the empire, transcending individuals' territories. Tenka refers to the non-religious sphere of power, separate from that of the tennō. Oda Nobunaga used it to refer to the "realm," the proper rule and welfare of which he deemed himself responsible.　[天皇、織田信長]　"
